AE parent class, containing initialization of parameters, encoder and decoder structure and common utils

class utils.AEs.classes.CNN_HAE(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: AE, Model

Hierarchical convolutional AE

call(input)[source]

Calls the model on new inputs and returns the outputs as tensors.

In this case call() just reapplies all ops in the graph to the new inputs (e.g. build a new computational graph from the provided inputs).

Note: This method should not be called directly. It is only meant to be overridden when subclassing tf.keras.Model. To call a model on an input, always use the __call__() method, i.e. model(inputs), which relies on the underlying call() method.

Parameters:

  • inputs – Input tensor, or dict/list/tuple of input tensors.

  • training – Boolean or boolean scalar tensor, indicating whether to run the Network in training mode or inference mode.

  • mask – A mask or list of masks. A mask can be either a boolean tensor or None (no mask). For more details, check the guide [here](https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/keras/masking_and_padding).

Returns:

A tensor if there is a single output, or a list of tensors if there are more than one outputs.

Modal CNN-AE (linear summation of modes)

call(input_img)[source]

Calls the model on new inputs and returns the outputs as tensors.

In this case call() just reapplies all ops in the graph to the new inputs (e.g. build a new computational graph from the provided inputs).

Note: This method should not be called directly. It is only meant to be overridden when subclassing tf.keras.Model. To call a model on an input, always use the __call__() method, i.e. model(inputs), which relies on the underlying call() method.

Parameters:

  • inputs – Input tensor, or dict/list/tuple of input tensors.

  • training – Boolean or boolean scalar tensor, indicating whether to run the Network in training mode or inference mode.

  • mask – A mask or list of masks. A mask can be either a boolean tensor or None (no mask). For more details, check the guide [here](https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/keras/masking_and_padding).

Returns:

A tensor if there is a single output, or a list of tensors if there are more than one outputs.

utils.AEs.energy module

utils.AEs.energy.energy_AE(D, out_AE, flag_AE, AE)[source]

Orders AE modes by energy content

Parameters:

  • D – snapshot matrix (N_v, N_t)

  • out_AE – AE modes (if MD-CNN-AE or CNN-HAE) or latent space (C-CNN-AE or CNN-VAE)

  • flag_AE – type of AE flag

  • AE – AE model class

Returns:

cumulative energy, energy arrays and indices of energy ordering

utils.AEs.energy.energy_POD(D, Phi, a)[source]

Retrieves energy and cumulative energy up to x number of modes (from 1 to N_r)

Parameters:

  • D – snapshot matrix (N_v, N_t)

  • Phi – spatial mode set (N_v, N_r)

  • a – temporal mode set (N_r, N_t)

Returns:

cumulative energy and energy arrays

utils.AEs.modes module

utils.AEs.modes.get_correlation_matrix(Phi)[source]

Obtains correlation matrix for AE modes

Parameters:

Phi – AE modes (N_v, N_t, N_z)

Returns:

determinant of correlation matrix and correlation matrx

utils.AEs.modes.get_modes_AE(AE, grid, D, N_z, flag_AE, flag_control, flag_static, z=0, b=0)[source]

Retrives equivalent AE modes, depending on AE type

Parameters:

  • AE – AE model class

  • grid – dictionary containing X, Y grids with mask

  • D – snapshot matrix (N_v, N_t)

  • N_z – number of latent coordinates

  • flag_AE – AE type

  • flag_control – 1 if control is embedded in AE, 0 otherwise

  • flag_static – 1 if modes are retrieved as static (latent space forced to 0s and 1s), 0 otherwise

  • z – latent space, if needed

  • b – control vector, if needed

Returns:

AE modes (N_v, N_t, N_z)

utils.AEs.outputs module

utils.AEs.outputs.get_AE_reconstruction(N_z, flag_AE, flag_control, AE, grid, D, b)[source]

Reconstructs flow field through AE (complete encoding-decoding process)

Parameters:

  • N_z – number of latent coordinates

  • flag_AE – AE type

  • flag_control – 1 if control is embedded in AE, 0 otherwise

  • AE – AE class model

  • grid – dictionary containing X,Y and mask grids

  • D – snapshot matrix

  • b – control vector, if needed

Returns:

reconstructed snapshot matrix

utils.AEs.outputs.get_AE_z(N_z, flag_AE, AE, grid, D)[source]

Gets latent space from AE

Parameters:

  • N_z – number of latent coordinates

  • flag_AE – AE type

  • AE – AE class model

  • grid – dictionary containing X,Y and mask grids

  • D – snapshot matrix

Returns:

latent space array

utils.AEs.train module

utils.AEs.train.train_AE(PARAMS, FLAGS, grid, D, logging, b=0)[source]

Trains and compiles AE

Parameters:

  • PARAMS – dictionary of parameters

  • FLAGS – dictionary of flags

  • grid – dictionary containing X,Y and mask grids

  • D – snapshot matrix (train + val set)

  • logging – logger object

  • b – control vector (if any)

Returns:

AE class model
